1.text: Then Baldad the Suhite answered, and said:

2.text: How long will you throw out words? understand first, and so let us speak.

3.text: Why are we reputed as beasts, and counted vile before you?

4.text: Thou that destroyest thy soul in thy fury, shall the earth be forsaken for thee, and shall rocks be removed out of their place?

5.text: Shall not the light of the wicked be extinguished, and the flame of his fire not shine?

6.text: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and the lamp that is over him, shall be put out.

7.text: The step of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down headlong.

8.text: For he hath thrust his feet into a net, and walketh in its meshes.

9.text: The sole of his foot shall be held in a snare, and thirst shall burn against him.

10.text: A gin is hidden for him in the earth, and his trap upon the path.

11.text: Fears shall terrify him on every side, and shall entangle his feet.

12.text: Let his strength be wasted with famine, and let hunger invade his ribs.

13.text: Let it devour the beauty of his skin, let the firstborn death consume his arms.

14.text: Let his confidence be rooted out of his tabernacle, and let destruction tread upon him like a king.

15.text: Let the companions of him that is not, dwell in his tabernacle, let brimstone be sprinkled in his tent.

16.text: Let his roots be dried up beneath, and his harvest destroyed above.

17.text: Let the memory of him perish from the earth and let not his name be renowned in the streets.

18.text: He shall drive him out of light into darkness, and shall remove him out of the world.

19.text: His seed shall not subsist, nor his offspring among his people, nor any remnants in his country.

20.text: They that come after him shall be astonished at his day, and horror shall fall upon them that went before.

21.text: These men are the tabernacles of the wicked, and this the place of him that knoweth not God.
